AsAs the title of the thread says really. What advantage is there to locking landing legs?

Edited September 11, 2015 by Clipperride

One trick:

Locking "downhill" legs, and keeping the "uphill" ones unlocked can help a lander settle more upright and prevent tipping, especially for heavier craft.
It kind of moves them up and down a bit which can be helpful for surface docking with bases.
If you have little clearance and a heavy craft, locking prevents you from crushing your engine.
Also can prevent heavy landers with high center of mass from leaning and tipping, even in flat terrain.
Thanks all. I've not really landed really heavy loads anywhere other than Minmus yet.
